# General Info

This script contains all the models tested in our manuscript (https://osf.io/preprints/psyarxiv/wvfnb). It requires JAGS. The script is structured s follows:

1. **Preparation:** loading libraries and load workspace
2. **Multi-attribute attentional DDM:** Function, Estimate maaDDM, Test Parameters and some graphs (corresponds to maaDDM), 
*note* the change compared to the main taste-health analyses: We merely exchange nutri as input DDMdata (line 75) and adapt the saved workspace and plot.

# 2 Multiattribute attentional DDM
## 2.1 Estimate maaDDM with hierarchical Bayesian modeling (JAGS)
```{r}
# get data and initial values together and specify the model
ddmData <- list('N'=N,'S'=S,'P'=P,'H'=H,'tasteA'=prefA,'tasteB'=prefB,'healthA'=nutriA,'healthB'=nutriB,'RT'=RT,
                'fixProp1'=fixProp1,'fixProp2'=fixProp2,'fixProp3'=fixProp3,'fixProp4'=fixProp4)

#starting values
nChains <- 8

T1<-Sys.time()
addmJAGS_want_nutri <- jags.parallel(ddmData,inits = NULL,jags.seed = sample(100:999,1),
                    parameters.to.save = c('mu_bound','sigma_bound','mu_ndt','sigma_ndt',
                                           'mu_drift','sigma_drift','mu_weight1','sigma_weight1',
                                           'mu_theta','sigma_theta','mu_phy','sigma_phy',
                                           'mu_bound_H','sigma_bound_H','mu_ndt_H','sigma_ndt_H',
                                           'mu_drift_H','sigma_drift_H','mu_weight1_H','sigma_weight1_H',
                                           'mu_theta_H','sigma_theta_H','mu_phy_H','sigma_phy_H',
                                           'bound','ndt','drift','weight1','theta','phy',
                                           'bound_H','ndt_H','drift_H','weight1_H','theta_H','phy_H'),
                    model.file = "BayesModel_maaDDM.txt",working.directory = 'BayesModels',
                    n.chains = nChains, n.iter = 60000, n.burnin = 30000,n.thin = 12, DIC = TRUE,jags.module = c("glm","dic","wiener"))
T2<-Sys.time() #T2-T1

# check convergence and fit
ddmRhats <- addmJAGS_want_nutri$BUGSoutput$summary[,8] #check with max(Rhats), which should ideally be < 1.01 (1.05 would also be okay)
max(ddmRhats)
addmJAGS_want_nutri$BUGSoutput$DIC
#save
save.image(file='maaDDM_want_nutri.RData')
```

## 2.2maaDDM_2w: check parameters (group posteriors)
```{r}
#get group parameter estimates in transformed form 
boundSep_S <- log(1+exp(addmJAGS_want_nutri$BUGSoutput$sims.list$mu_bound))
boundSep_H <- log(1+exp(addmJAGS_want_nutri$BUGSoutput$sims.list$mu_bound+addmJAGS_want_nutri$BUGSoutput$sims.list$mu_bound_H))
boundSep_delta <- addmJAGS_want_nutri$BUGSoutput$sims.list$mu_bound_H

ndt_S <- log(1+exp(addmJAGS_want_nutri$BUGSoutput$sims.list$mu_ndt))
ndt_H <- log(1+exp(addmJAGS_want_nutri$BUGSoutput$sims.list$mu_ndt+addmJAGS_want_nutri$BUGSoutput$sims.list$mu_ndt_H))
ndt_delta <- addmJAGS_want_nutri$BUGSoutput$sims.list$mu_ndt_H

weight1_S <- pnorm(addmJAGS_want_nutri$BUGSoutput$sims.list$mu_weight1)
weight1_H <- pnorm(addmJAGS_want_nutri$BUGSoutput$sims.list$mu_weight1+addmJAGS_want_nutri$BUGSoutput$sims.list$mu_weight1_H)
weight1_delta <- addmJAGS_want_nutri$BUGSoutput$sims.list$mu_weight1_H

drift_S <- log(1+exp(addmJAGS_want_nutri$BUGSoutput$sims.list$mu_drift))
drift_H <- log(1+exp(addmJAGS_want_nutri$BUGSoutput$sims.list$mu_drift+addmJAGS_want_nutri$BUGSoutput$sims.list$mu_drift_H))
drift_delta <- addmJAGS_want_nutri$BUGSoutput$sims.list$mu_drift_H

theta_S <- (addmJAGS_want_nutri$BUGSoutput$sims.list$mu_theta)
theta_H <- (addmJAGS_want_nutri$BUGSoutput$sims.list$mu_theta+addmJAGS_want_nutri$BUGSoutput$sims.list$mu_theta_H)
theta_delta <- addmJAGS_want_nutri$BUGSoutput$sims.list$mu_theta_H

phy_S <- (addmJAGS_want_nutri$BUGSoutput$sims.list$mu_phy)
phy_H <- (addmJAGS_want_nutri$BUGSoutput$sims.list$mu_phy+addmJAGS_want_nutri$BUGSoutput$sims.list$mu_phy_H)
phy_delta <- addmJAGS_want_nutri$BUGSoutput$sims.list$mu_phy_H

##plot each parameter with condition differences

## PLOT 

#1) Taste weight 
histGran <- (-300:300)/150
# Create a data frame
datatw <- data.frame(weight1_S = weight1_S, weight1_H = weight1_H)
# Plot using ggplot2
tasteweight1<-ggplot(datatw, aes(x = weight1_S)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 1/100, fill = "cornflowerblue", alpha = 0.5, color = "black") +
  geom_histogram(aes(x = weight1_H), binwidth = 1/100, fill = "gold", alpha = 0.5, color = "black") +
  labs(x = "Taste Weight", y = "Frequency") +
  #scale_x_continuous(limits = c(-0.1, 0.25)) +
  ylim(0, 5000)+
  myTheme
# effect of hunger 
data_deltatw <- data.frame(weight1_delta = weight1_delta)
HDI_tw <- quantile(weight1_delta,c(.025,.975))
# Plot using ggplot2
tasteweight2<-ggplot(data_deltatw, aes(x = weight1_delta)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 1/25, fill = "grey", alpha = 0.5, color = "black") +
  geom_vline(xintercept = 0, color = "red", size = 1.5) +
  geom_vline(xintercept = HDI_tw, color = "black", size = 1, linetype = "dashed") +
  ylim(0, 5000)+
  #xlim(-0.1, 0.8)+
  labs(x = "Effect of Hunger", y = "Frequency") +
  myTheme

# 2) Scaling

# Create a data frame

# Plot using ggplot2
```
